FuncDef:
The if-match gre command configures a matching rule based on inner information in GRE packets in a traffic classifier.
The undo if-match gre command deletes a matching rule based on inner information in GRE packets in a traffic classifier. The if-match gre command configures a matching rule based on inner information in GRE packets in a traffic classifier. The undo if-match gre command deletes a matching rule based on inner information in GRE packets in a traffic classifier. By default, a matching rule based on inner information in GRE packets is not configured in a traffic classifier. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: if-match gre [ inner-source-ip <source-ip-address> [ mask <source-masklen> ] | inner-destination-ip <dest-ip-address> [ mask <dest-masklen> ] | inner-protocol <protocol> | inner-source-port <source-port-begin> | inner-destination-port <dest-port-begin> ]

undo if-match gre [ inner-source-ip <source-ip-address> [ mask <source-masklen> ] | inner-destination-ip <dest-ip-address> [ mask <dest-masklen> ] | inner-protocol <protocol> | inner-source-port <source-port-begin> | inner-destination-port <dest-port-begin> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the inner source IP address in GRE packets.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length of an IP address.
The value is an integer in the range from 0 to 32.

Specifies the mask length of an IP address.
The value is an integer in the range from 0 to 32.

Specifies the inner destination IP address in GRE packets.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the inner protocol number in GRE packets.
The value is an integer in the range from 0 to 255.

Specifies the inner source port number in GRE packets.
The value is an integer in the range from 0 to 65535.

Specifies the inner destination port number in GRE packets.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 65535.

ExtraInfo:
GRE encapsulates packets of a protocol into packets of another protocol to transparently transmit packets over GRE tunnels. GRE solves the transmission problem on heterogeneous networks.
You can run the if-match gre command to classify GRE packets inner information in GRE packets so that the device processes GRE packets matching the same traffic classifier in the same manner and provides fine-granular services.
